scenarioDescription:
The GJ 9066 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 9066 is a star with 0.15 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

GJ 9066 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 9066 system


GJ 9066 b

GJ 9066 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2020-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 9066 b is 30.916 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 9066 b is 6.100 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 9066 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


GJ 9066 c

GJ 9066 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2020-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.87 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 9066 c is 71.639 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 9066 c is 10.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 9066 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 9066, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: GJ 9066 - System With 2 Exoplanets
